CHAPTER XIV

THE UNIVERSAL WEAL

THE ideal religion must set before us the universal weal as the ultimate goal.

The universal weal must be the weal of God, because vve cannot conceive of God as satisfied until His creation is conformed to His intention. But how can vve conceive God's welfare as dependent on His universe? All our positive thought of God must be of Him in relation to our universe. Of anything beyond out· universe we can only think negatively. Man is forced to think of God negatively‚ as always existing beyond our physical universe and beyond our thought3 he can think of Him positively only as the source of all energy in nature and as what We have described as an artist in life.
